bill_title: prohibit eluding a law enforcement officer by means other than a motor vehicle and to provide a penalty therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit eluding a law enforcement officer by means other than a motor vehicle and to provide a penalty therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Except as provided in § § 22-11-4, 22-11-5, and 32-33-18, any person who flees or attempts to elude a law enforcement officer, by any means other than a motor vehicle, after being given a visual or audible signal to stop, is guilty of eluding a law enforcement officer if the officer is acting under color of the officers' official authority, with reasonable suspicion while attempting to further a criminal investigation, and is in uniform or prominently displays a badge of office. Eluding a law enforcement officer is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Any person who is found guilty of eluding a law enforcement officer is subject to the following additional enhanced penalties if the course of eluding results in: (1) Death or great bodily injury to another person, a Class 4 felony; (2) Substantial bodily injury to another person or damage in excess of five hundred dollars to public or private property belonging to any governing body or any person other than the person eluding, a Class 6 felony. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
